p: Flavonoids (C 6-C 3-C 6) are generally constituted by two benzenic rings (A ring and B ring) linked by a chain made of three carbons, often condensed into a pyranic ring (C ring). Given their complexity, flavonoids are divided into other sub-classes such as: chalcones, dihydrochalcones, aurones, flavones, flavonols, dihydroflavonol, flavanones, flavanol, flavandiol or leucoanthocyanidin, anthocyanidin, isoflavonoids. Moreover, flavonoids exist in the aglycone form or as glycoside derivatives [ 30].
